content:
Look at this linter error: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9737759182/job/26870304082?pr=14140#step:21:12
It reports that the braided category import is not necessary. However, it is necessary, because in the file I test that the RigidCategory instance is inferred correct (after defining the right rigid category instance.) But I guess the linter doesn't check for uses inside example. How should I handle this?
I believe the warning suggests lake exe shake --update.
Pretty sure that just removes the import and causes the file to fail to build
I think lake exe shake --fix does what you are saying. I haven't used either of these commands personally though.
I am confused, maybe you are misunderstanding my question. The import is detected as unused, but is actually used and removing the import causes the file to break
Then you tell the shake tool to ignore it with shake --update
Ohh wait ok sorry I missed that part of the warning
ok thanks, it adds the file to scripts/noshake.json
Gareth Ma has marked this topic as resolved.
